trans-unit.source: Represents the length of elements that explicitly support <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Star"></xref> unit types.

Elements such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> use this type to describe width and height in order to support variable distribution of available space.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*doubleLength*

The elementâ€™s length, described as either a <xref:System.Double> value that specifies a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)] measure, or as a *qualifiedDouble* (see below).
*autoValue*
The element's length, described by either the value Auto or *.
See <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType> for more information on the values Auto and *.
*qualifiedDouble*
A *double* value as described above for any of the measures, followed by one of the following unit declaration strings: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
`cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px
`pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structure using the specified absolute value in pixels.
The number of device-independent pixels (96 pixels-per-inch).
Pixels is equal to , , or .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structure and specifies what kind of value it holds.
The initial value of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref> held by this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
value is equal to , , or .
Gets an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> that holds a value whose size is determined by the size properties of the content object.

A instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> whose <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Auto"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> instance.
The object to compare with the current instance.
`true` if the specified object has the same value and <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref> as the current instance; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structure to compare with the current instance.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> has the same value and <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType"></xref> as the current instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a hash code for the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structure.
Gets the associated <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Auto"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> holds a value that is expressed in pixels.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType"></xref> property is <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Pixel"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> holds a value whose size is determined by the size properties of the content object.
The default <xref:System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType%2A> value is <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType?displayProperty=fullName>.
Therefore, this property returns `true` if you do not specify a <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType> when creating the instance.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType"></xref> property is <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Auto"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> holds a value that is expressed as a weighted proportion of available space.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength.GridUnitType"></xref> property is <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType.Star"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structures for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> have the same value and <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structures to determine if they are not equal.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> do not have the same value and <xref href="System.Windows.GridUnitType"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the current <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> structure.
Gets a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the value of the current instance.
